div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 612px; height: 1px; padding-top: 695px; margin-left: 1430px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
close_*
The
close_*
configuration options are used to close the harvester after a certain criteria or time. Closing the harvester means closing the
file handler
. If a file is updated after the harvester is closed, the file will be picked up again after
scan_frequency
has elapsed. However, if the file is moved or deleted while the harvester is closed, Filebeat will not be able to pick up the file again, and any data that the harvester hasn’t read will be lost. The close_* settings are applied
synchronously when Filebeat attempts to read from a file
,
meaning that if Filebeat is in a blocked state due to blocked output, full queue or other issue, a file that would otherwise be closed remains open until Filebeat once again attempts to read from the file(即 close_* 只发生在尝试读文件的时候，而不是由 timer 精确实时控制的。即 close 是在读文件的 harvester 纤程中执行的， timer 纤程只负责异步通知。由于 filebeat 可能由于 output 的 queue full 而停止读文件，即 back pressure，所以文件不一定可以准时 close).

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 612px; height: 1px; padding-top: 405px; margin-left: 2370px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; font-family: "inter" ; line-height: normal ; color: rgb(33 , 37 , 41) ; font-size: 13px ; position: relative

code.style: box-sizing: border-box ; font-family: "consolas" , "menlo" , "dejavu sans mono" , "bitstream vera sans mono" , "lucida console" , monospace ; font-size: 13px ; color: rgb(85 , 85 , 85) ; word-break: break-word ; padding: 0px 3px ; display: inline

span.style: box-sizing: border-box ; font-weight: 400 ; right: 0px ; position: absolute ; top: 0px ; z-index: 1000 ; padding-top: 26px ; line-height: 1 ; opacity: 0.3 ; background-repeat: no-repeat ; background-image: url("data:image/png;base64,")

p.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin-top: 0px ; margin-bottom: 1.15em ; font-family: "inter" , sans-serif ; font-size: 13px
p.span: When this option is enabled, Filebeat closes the file handle if a file has not been harvested for the specified duration. The counter for the defined period starts when the last log line was read by the harvester(
p.font: 在每次完整读取一行日志后，timer reset
). It is not based on the modification time of the file. If the closed file changes again, a new harvester is started and the latest changes will be picked up after

code.style: color: rgb(85 , 85 , 85) ; box-sizing: border-box ; font-family: "consolas" , "menlo" , "dejavu sans mono" , "bitstream vera sans mono" , "lucida console" , monospace ; font-size: 13px ; word-break: break-word ; padding: 0px 3px ; display: inline

p.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin-top: 0px ; margin-bottom: 1.15em ; font-family: "inter" , sans-serif ; color: rgb(33 , 37 , 41) ; font-size: 13px

div.p:
We recommended that you set
close_inactive
to a value that is larger than the
least frequent updates to your log files
. For example, if your log files get updated every few seconds, you can safely set
close_inactive
to
1m
. If there are log files with very different update rates, you can use multiple configurations with different values.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin-top: 0px ; margin-bottom: 1.15em ; font-family: "inter" , sans-serif ; color: rgb(33 , 37 , 41) ; font-size: 13px

div.p:
Setting
close_inactive
to a lower value means that file handles are closed sooner. However this has the side effect that new log lines are not sent in near real time if the harvester is closed.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin-top: 0px ; margin-bottom: 1.15em ; font-family: "inter" , sans-serif ; color: rgb(33 , 37 , 41) ; font-size: 13px

div.p:
The timestamp for closing a file does not depend on the modification time of the file. Instead, Filebeat uses an internal timestamp that reflects when the file was last harvested. For example, if
close_inactive
is set to 5 minutes, the countdown for the 5 minutes starts after the harvester reads the last line of the file.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin-top: 0px ; margin-bottom: 1.15em ; font-family: "inter" , sans-serif ; color: rgb(33 , 37 , 41) ; font-size: 13px

div.p: You can use time strings like 2h (2 hours) and 5m (5 minutes). The default is 5m.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 342px; height: 1px; padding-top: 145px; margin-left: 2150px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.b: least frequent updates to log file

switch.text: least frequent updates to log file

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 295px; margin-left: 2432px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 612px; height: 1px; padding-top: 885px; margin-left: 2370px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: When this option is enabled, Filebeat closes the harvester when a file is removed. Normally a file should only be removed after it’s inactive for the duration specified by close_inactive. However, if a file is removed early and you don’t enable close_removed, Filebeat keeps the file open to make sure the harvester has completed. If this setting results in files that are not completely read because they are removed from disk too early, disable this option.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: This option is enabled by default. If you disable this option, you must also disable clean_removed.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: WINDOWS: If your Windows log rotation system shows errors because it can’t rotate files, make sure this option is enabled.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; font-family: "inter" ; line-height: normal ; color: rgb(33 , 37 , 41) ; font-size: 13px ; position: relative

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 732px; height: 1px; padding-top: 770px; margin-left: 3235px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 220px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.pre:
// IsRemoved checks wheter the file held by f is removed.
func IsRemoved
(
f
*
os
.
File
)
bool
{
stat
,
err
:
=
f
.
Stat
(
)
if
err
!
=
nil
{
// if we got an error from a Stat call just assume we are removed
return
true
}
sysStat
:
=
stat
.
Sys
(
)
.
(
*
syscall
.
Stat_t
)
return
sysStat
.
Nlink
=
=
0
}

switch.text: // 这里用 fd 来获取文件的 NLink，而不是 path，原因是文件名可能被 rotate 修改。...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 967px; margin-left: 3110px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 612px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1145px; margin-left: 1540px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: Only use this option if you understand that data loss is a potential side effect. Another side effect is that multiline events might not be completely sent before the timeout expires.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: When this option is enabled, Filebeat gives every harvester a predefined lifetime. Regardless of where the reader is in the file, reading will stop after the close_timeout period has elapsed. This option can be useful for older log files when you want to spend only a predefined amount of time on the files. While close_timeout will close the file after the predefined timeout, if the file is still being updated, Filebeat will start a new harvester again per the defined scan_frequency. And the close_timeout for this harvester will start again with the countdown for the timeout.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace

span.font: This option is particularly useful in case the output is blocked

, which makes Filebeat keep open file handlers even for files that were deleted from the disk. Setting close_timeout to 5m ensures that the files are periodically closed so they can be freed up by the operating system.(output 堵塞时，可以关闭 fd 以让硬盘空间可以回收)

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: If you set close_timeout to equal
, the file will not be picked up if it’s modified while the harvester is closed. This combination of settings normally leads to data loss, and the complete file is not sent.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: When you use close_timeout for logs that contain multiline events, the harvester might stop in the middle of a multiline event, which means that only parts of the event will be sent. If the harvester is started again and the file still exists, only the second part of the event will be sent.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

font.face: consolas, menlo, dejavu sans mono, bitstream vera sans mono, lucida console, monospace
font.span: This option is set to 0 by default which means it is disabled.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 392px; height: 1px; padding-top: 565px; margin-left: 40px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 542px; height: 1px; padding-top: 995px; margin-left: 10px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: scan_frequency : default=10s

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: How often Filebeat checks for new files in the paths that are specified for harvesting. For example, if you specify a glob like /var/log/*, the directory is scanned for files using the frequency specified by scan_frequency. Specify 1s to scan the directory as frequently as possible without causing Filebeat to scan too frequently. We do not recommend to set this value <1s.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: If you require log lines to be sent in near real time do not use a very low
scan_frequency
but adjust
close_inactive
so the file handler stays open and constantly polls your files.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 692px; height: 1px; padding-top: 15px; margin-left: 560px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: clean_inactive

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: Only use this option if you understand that data loss is a potential side effect.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative

div.h5:
When this option is enabled, Filebeat removes the state of a file after the specified period of inactivity has elapsed.
The state can only be removed if the file is already ignored by Filebeat (the file is older than
ignore_older
)
. The clean_inactive setting must be greater than
ignore_older
+
scan_frequency
to make sure that no states are removed while a file is still being harvested. Otherwise, the setting could result in Filebeat resending the full content constantly because
clean_inactive
removes state for files that are still detected by Filebeat. If a file is updated or appears again, the file is read from the beginning.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: The clean_inactive configuration option is useful to reduce the size of the registry file, especially if a large amount of new files are generated every day.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: This config option is also useful to prevent Filebeat problems resulting from inode reuse on Linux. For more information, see Inode reuse causes Filebeat to skip lines.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: Every time a file is
renamed
, the file state is updated and the counter for
clean_inactive
starts at 0 again.(文件名修改了就 reset)

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: During testing, you might notice that the registry contains state entries that should be removed based on the
clean_inactive

setting. This happens because Filebeat doesn’t remove the entries until it opens the registry again to read a different file. If you are testing the clean_inactive setting, make sure Filebeat is configured to read from more than one file, or the file state will never be removed from the registry.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 485px; margin-left: 495px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 700px; margin-left: 555px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 592px; height: 1px; padding-top: 205px; margin-left: 1440px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: clean_removed : default=enable

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: When this option is enabled, Filebeat cleans files from the registry if they cannot be found on disk anymore under the last known name. This means also files which were
renamed
after the harvester was finished will be removed. This option is enabled by default.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: If a shared drive disappears for a short period and appears again, all files will be read again from the beginning because the states were removed from the registry file. In such cases, we recommend that you disable the clean_removed option.

h5.style: box-sizing: border-box ; margin: 16px 0px 5px ; line-height: normal ; position: relative
h5.span: You must disable this option if you also disable close_removed.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 570px; margin-left: 2080px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); white-space: nowrap;

div.div:
You must disable
clean_removed
if you also disable
close_removed
.
<<depends>>

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
